intro: Satureja bonariensis, commonly known as Argentine thyme, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are fragrant, containing essential oils that contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. Satureja bonariensis is often used in traditional medicine for its antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties.
